column1: TRUCE_TRADE_DEAL0:"\nTruce signed in exchange for cessation of raiding"
fp1_trade_events.0002.desc0:"As my troops and I prepare to sack the lands of [county.GetNameNoTierNoTooltip]
column2: our first scouts report back.\n\nIt seems the local towns are rich
column4: and we could well be caught out by vengeful armies before we can break into the juiciest targets.\n\nAll is not lost: the art of good raiding is all in exploiting opportunity
column5: and we could perhaps arrange trade and tribute in exchange for staying our blades."

column1: fp1_trade_events.0002.a0:"Perhaps the local [county.GetHolder.GetTitleAsNameNoTooltip] will be amenable?"
fp1_trade_events.0002.b0:"A truce with the ruling [county.GetHolder.GetTopLiege.GetTitleAsNameNoTooltip] could be invaluable..."

column2: we probably #EMP could#! make money trading. Pillage it anyway."

column1: fp1_trade_events.0002.d0:"What kind of lily-livered #EMP feudal#! coward makes money without raiding?"
fp1_trade_events.0002.d.tt0:"You pillage [county.GetNameNoTierNoTooltip] and refuse to think about trading instead of raiding for the rest of your life"

column2: pirates
column3: and other heavily-armed scoundrels has entered [county.GetNameNoTierNoTooltip]
column5: my scouts thought them here to pillage
column6: but an emissary from their [raider.GetTitleAsNameNoTooltip] claims that they would happily trade instead. Their force is rich in plunder
column8: and this would give the locals a chance to buy exotic goods from across the world.\n\nThe subtext is clear. Trade under preferable terms and they will depart in peace
column9: or reject their offer and they will take what they wish."

column2: but highly welcome."
I have had an understanding with [recipient.GetTitledFirstName]. My raiders keep their weapons in their belts in [recipient.GetHerHis] lands
column3: and [recipient.GetHerHis] subjects buy the exotic luxuries we take from less diplomatic realms.\n\nThe terms of our agreement have almost run their course
column5: and many among my retinue are reluctant to give up their convenient trade contacts.\n\nPerhaps [recipient.GetFirstNameNoTooltip] would be open to an extension?"

column1: fp1_trade_events.0012.desc.outro0:"my agreement with [raider.GetTitledFirstName] has stood firm: [raider.GetSheHe] keeps [raider.GetHerHis] dogs leashed in my lands
column2: and my merchants buy the loot [raider.GetSheHe] steals from elsewhere.\n\nWith the impending approach of the agreement's end
column3: [raider.GetFirstNameNoTooltip] has reached out to inquire about an extension.\n\nPrivately
column4: several of [raider.GetHerHis] wealthier warriors have offered choice gifts should I keep giving them such free access to our markets
column5: and it #EMP is#! nice not having to worry about angry [raider.GetPrimaryTitle.GetAdjectiveNoTooltip] raiders pillaging the countryside..."

column1: fp1_trade_events.0021.desc0:"My trade agreement with [partner.GetTitledFirstName] ensures a steady flow of my merchants and petty nobility visit [partner.GetHerHis] lands
column2: flogging their loot and importing foreign luxuries.\n\nDecidedly less common is an expedition from [partner.GetPrimaryTitle.GetNameNoTier] making its way to [ROOT.Char.GetPrimaryTitle.GetNameNoTier]
column3: often something of an event in [ROOT.Char.GetCapitalLocation.GetTitle.GetNameNoTier]. It can be rare to see so many distant foreigners with hands unbound.\n\nThe leaders of such an expedition have managed to garner an audience to beg for patronage: an eloquent [priest.GetFaith.PriestNeuter] and a keen-minded merchant."

column1: fp1_trade_events.0021.a0:"I could use someone to count my coin..."

column2: [priest.GetFirstNameNoTooltip]!"

column1: fp1_trade_events.0021.c0:"And who is that accompanying you at the back?"

column2: foreigners

column1: fp1_trade_events.0031.desc0:"The raiders of [raider.GetTitledFirstNameNoTooltip] are a fearsome bunch
column2: enough that I'm often thankful that we count each other as cautious friends rather than bloody enemies.\n\nOne of the more #EMP vicious#! of [raider.GetHerHis] minor terrors counted among their number is [warrior.GetFirstName]
column3: a reaver of no small repute.\n\nWhen [warrior.GetSheHe] asked for an audience
column4: I was half-expecting an assassination attempt
column5: but am #EMP pleasantly#! surprised to find the ambitious young warrior wishes to offer [warrior.GetHerHis] services."

column2: bandit."

column1: fp1_trade_events.0041.desc0:"My arrangement with [partner.GetTitledFirstName] is a mutually beneficial one
column2: yet I sometimes wonder if it is living up to its potential. My lands could use the touch of [partner.GetHerHis] veteran masons and carpenters
column3: and though [partner.GetSheHe] is safe from my raiders
column4: many others have no such arrangement.\n\nWith a little joint spending to facilitate the  transit of our servants
column5: we could solve both of these problems together: [partner.GetFirstNameNoTooltip] sends skilled craftspeople to serve me for a time
column7: I loan [partner.GetHerHim] elderly raiders and eager settlers as advisers to help keep [partner.GetHerHis] lands safe."

column1: fp1_trade_events.0041.a.advanced0:"Could they build me a palace in the [partner.GetCulture.GetNameNoTooltip] style?"

column2: [raider.GetTitledFirstName]
column3: has sent word of an intriguing offer. Though it's true that my lands are safe from [raider.GetHerHis] raiders
column4: the same is not true of many other villains and vagrants
column5: while [raider.GetHerHis] lands are poor and underdeveloped.\n\nWere we both to front the travel costs for our servants
column6: [raider.GetFirstNameNoTooltip] suggests an exchange program of sorts: veteran warriors and settlers from [raider.GetHerHis] lands will be sent to help protect one of my vulnerable frontiers from less tactile thieves
column7: and skilled masons and carpenters from my realm will serve a tour in [raider.GetHerHis] domain."

column1: fp1_trade_events.0051.b0:"[option_2.GetNameNoTierNoTooltip] might be a good place for them?"
fp1_trade_events.0051.c0:"I think I'd prefer to shore up [option_3.GetNameNoTierNoTooltip]."

column2: landless freemen
column3: desperate lesser children and other assorted miscreants have joined [attacker.GetFirstName] in [attacker.GetHerHis] proposed assault against my holdings.\n\nAlthough the size of the force is formidable
column5: with each scrounged mercenary focused exclusively on what they can get out of the war first and foremost.\n\nUnlike a conventional foe
column6: it might be possible to simply deal directly with the invaders. Perhaps a bargain could be struck..."

column1: fp1_trade_events.1131.a0:"Never! Back to your frozen hellscape of a home
column2: scum!"
why not give it to them?"
soldiers prefer gold to glory..."

column1: fp1_trade_events.1131.c.tt0:"You pay a gafol directly to [attacker.GetFirstNamePossessiveNoTooltip] troops to have them disband"
fp1_trade_events.1131.d0:"We'll banish these invaders as we've always done."
fp1_trade_events.1131.d.tt0:"You fight the Nords the old-fashioned way"

column2: my relationship with [partner.GetTitledFirstName] has only grown stronger with time.\n\nStronger
column5: as [partner.GetHerHis] last letter expressed a sincere concern for the fate of my soul.\n\nIn an effort to entice me to convert to [partner.GetFaith.GetName]
column7: a grand ceremony to welcome me into the faith

column1: fp1_trade_events.1171.a0:"[partner.GetSheHe|U] #EMP does#! make quite a compelling case..."
fp1_trade_events.1171.b0:"What a gesture! To ever-lasting friendship!"

column2: as well as..."
I expect a better bribe than that."

column1: fp1_trade_events.1171.c.fallback0:"No manner of bribes can tempt me away from [raider.GetFaith.GetNameNoTooltip]."
